title: Authors and Citation
text: Annika Swenne. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Swenne (2025). “dsGamlssClient: DataSHIELD client-side functions fit generalized additive models location, scale shape.” R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/bibs-hb/dsGamlssClient.
code: @Misc{,   title = {dsGamlssClient: DataSHIELD client-side functions to fit generalized additive models for location, scale and shape},   author = {Annika Swenne},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/bibs-hb/dsGamlssClient},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
title: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
text: dsGamlssClient package DataSHIELD client-side package includes server-side functions fit Generalized Additive Models Location, Scale Shape (GAMLSS) [1] using DataSHIELD. based original gamlss implementation [1] dsBaseClient package [2].

title: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
text: DataSHIELD software infrastructure allows non-disclosive federated analysis sensitive data. DataSHIELD website depth descriptions , works install . key point highlight DataSHIELD client-server infrastructure, dsGamlssClient package needs used conjunction dsGamlss package - trying use one without makes sense. Detailed instructions install DataSHIELD can found DataSHIELD Wiki. Discussion help using DataSHIELD can obtained DataSHIELD Forum.

title: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
text: can install dsGamlssClient package GitHub : successfully run package, dsBase dsGamlss server-side packages must installed DataSHIELD server. Instructions install server-side package DataSHIELD server can found Data Manager Section DataSHIELD Wiki.

title: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
text: example uses server-less DataSHIELD implementation DSLite [3] illustrate use package’s main functions ds.gamlss ds.predict.gamlss. Thus, access DataSHIELD server required follow example. First, need install DSLite package, available CRAN. Note DSLite package required want use server-less DataSHIELD implementation. instead using Armadillo Opal DataSHIELD servers must install DSMolgenisArmadillo DSOpal package CRAN install.packages("DSMolgenisArmadillo") install.packages("DSOpal"). Furthermore, follow example, server-side packages dsBase dsGamlss must installed GitHub global environment. , necessary server-less DataSHIELD implementation. using Armadillo Opal DataSHIELD servers, must install dsBase dsGamlss packages server, described e.g. Data Manager Section DataSHIELD Wiki. illustrative purposes, mtcars example data split across two servers. Therefore, two DSLite servers set , required server-side packages dsBase dsGamlss. Furthermore, server holds subset mtcars data. Analyzing data two servers jointly ds.gamlss, mathematically equivalent fitting GAMLSS model whole mtcars data. Note however, nonparametric terms included model, might slight numerical differences ds.gamlss gamlss::gamlss, since matrix equation obtain regression coefficients solved differently. , one can apply ds.gamlss function fit GAMLSS model. case, assumed minimum maximum wt, used determine knots penalized beta spline, known non-disclosive. However, might always case instead, anonymized minimum maximum can used determine knots. Note implies knots different GAMLSS model fit whole mctars dataset, hence results ds.gamlss slightly different GAMLSS model fit whole data. However, impact interpretation model. ds.gamlss model fit can used predict different distribution parameters, e.g. mu distribution parameter. Therefore new data frame explanatory variables included model must created.
code: install.packages("DSLite", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org/") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("datashield/dsBase") devtools::install_github("bips-hb/dsGamlss") library(dsGamlssClient) library(DSLite) library(dsBase) library(dsGamlss) data(mtcars) dslite.server1 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(1:15), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) dslite.server2 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(16:nrow(mtcars)), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) builder <- DSI::newDSLoginBuilder() builder$append(server = "study1", url = "dslite.server1", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") builder$append(server = "study2", url = "dslite.server2", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") logindata.dslite <- builder$build() # Login to the virtualized server conns <- DSI::datashield.login(logindata.dslite, assign = TRUE) #>  #> Logging into the collaborating servers #>  #>   No variables have been specified.  #>   All the variables in the table  #>   (the whole dataset) will be assigned to R! #>  #> Assigning table data... DSI::datashield.assign.table(conns = conns, symbol = "D", table = c("data", "data")) model <- ds.gamlss(   formula = mpg ~ pb(wt), sigma.formula = ~wt,   min.values = min(mtcars$wt),   max.values = max(mtcars$wt),   min.max.names = "wt",   data = "D", family = "NO()" ) #> Outer iteration 1... #> Outer iteration 2... #> Outer iteration 3... model <- ds.gamlss(formula = mpg ~ pb(wt), sigma.formula = ~wt, data = "D", family = "NO()") #> Outer iteration 1... #> Outer iteration 2... #> Outer iteration 3... newdata <- data.frame(wt = seq(2, 5, by = 0.01)) mu.response <- ds.predict.gamlss(model, newdata, what = "mu", type = "response") head(mu.response) #>       [,1] #> 1 27.71961 #> 2 27.64003 #> 3 27.56050 #> 4 27.48102 #> 5 27.40159 #> 6 27.32221

title: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape
text: Rigby RA, Stasinopoulos DM. Generalized additive models location, scale shape. Journal Royal Statistical Society: Series C (Applied Statistics). 2005;54(3):507-54. DataSHIELD Developers (2023). dsBaseClient: DataSHIELD Client Functions. R package version 6.3.0. Marcon Y (2022). DSLite: ‘DataSHIELD’ Implementation Local Datasets. R package version 1.4.0, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=DSLite.

what: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
text: Fits Generalized Additive Model Location, Scale shape (GAMLSS) using DataSHIELD data single source multiple sources server side.

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
code: ds.gamlss(   formula = NULL,   sigma.formula = ~1,   nu.formula = ~1,   tau.formula = ~1,   family = "NO()",   data = NULL,   min.values = NULL,   max.values = NULL,   min.max.names = NULL,   checks = FALSE,   mu.fix = FALSE,   sigma.fix = FALSE,   nu.fix = FALSE,   tau.fix = FALSE,   control = c(0.001, 20, 1, 1, 1, 1, Inf),   i.control = c(0.001, 50, 30, 0.001),   autostep = TRUE,   datasources = NULL )

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
text: formula formula object, specifying model mu distribution parameter. response left ~ operator, terms, separated + operators, right. Currently, penalized beta splines, indicated pb(), supported nonparametric smoothing, e.g. y~pb(x1)+x2+x2*x3. sigma.formula formula object, specifying model sigma distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. sigma.formula=~pb(x). nu.formula formula object, specifying model nu distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. nu.formula=~pb(x). tau.formula formula object, specifying model tau distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. tau.formula=~pb(x). family string, specifying distribution response variable link functions distribution parameters. Currently, following families supported: family=c('()', 'NO2()', 'BCCG()', 'BCPE()'). Details distributions can found gamlss.family. Default family='()'. data string, specifying name (optional) data frame server-side containing variables occurring formulas. missing, variables parent environment server-side referenced explicitly dataname$varname. min.values numeric vector specifying minimum values covariates, used determine knots pb(). min.values=NULL anonymized (noisy) minimum used instead determine knots servers. Default min.values=NULL. max.values numeric vector specifying maximum values covariates, used determine knots pb(). max.values=NULL anonymized (noisy) maximum used instead determine knots servers. Default min.values=NULL. min.max.names string vector specifying names minimum (min.values) maximum values (max.values). required min.values max.values given. Default min.max.names=NULL. checks Logical, checks=TRUE ds.gamlss checks whether required variables model exist server completely missing. Default checks=FALSE. mu.fix Logical, indicating whether mu distribution parameter kept fixed fitting processes. Default mu.fix=FALSE. sigma.fix Logical, indicating whether sigma distribution parameter kept fixed fitting processes. Default sigma.fix=FALSE. nu.fix Logical, indicating whether nu distribution parameter kept fixed fitting processes. Default nu.fix=FALSE. tau.fix Logical, indicating whether tau distribution parameter kept fixed fitting processes. Default tau.fix=FALSE. control Numeric vector seven elements sets control parameters outer iterations algorithm using gamlss.control function: () c.crit (convergence criterion algorithm), (ii) n.cyc (number cycles algorithm), (iii) mu.step (step length distribution parameter mu), (iv) sigma.step (step length distribution parameter sigma), (v) nu.step (step length distribution parameter nu), (vi) tau.step (step length distribution parameter tau), (vii) gd.tol (global deviance tolerance level). Default control=c(0.001, 20, 1, 1, 1, 1, Inf). .control Numeric vector four elements sets control parameters inner iterations RS algorithm using glim.control function: () cc (convergence criterion algorithm), (ii) cyc (number cycles algorithm), (iii) bf.cyc (number cycles backfitting algorithm), (iv) bf.tol (convergence criterion (tolerance level) backfitting algorithm). Default .control=c(0.001, 50, 30, 0.001). autostep Logical, indicating whether steps halved automatically new global deviance greater old one. Default autostep=TRUE. datasources list DSConnection-class objects obtained login. datasources argument specified default set connections used: see datashield.connections_default.

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
text: ds.gamlss object components gamlss function. Individual-level information like components y (response) residuals (normalised quantile residuals model) disclosed client-side.

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
text: Fits Generalized Additive model Location, scale shape (GAMLSS) using DataSHIELD data single source multiple sources server side. latter case, data co-analysed (using ds.gamlss)  using approach mathematically equivalent placing individual-level data sources one central warehouse analysing data using conventional gamlss function R. additional details please see header  gamlss function. Server functions called: gamlssDS1,                          gamlssDS2,                          gamlssDS3,                          gamlssDS4,                          gamlssDS5,                          gamlssDS6

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
text: Annika Swenne

title: Generalized Additive Models for Location Scale and Shape using DataSHIELD — ds.gamlss
code: library(DSLite) #> Loading required package: DSI #> Loading required package: progress #> Loading required package: R6 #> Loading required package: rly data(mtcars)  ## Set up DSLite server dslite.server1 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(1:15), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) dslite.server2 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(16:nrow(mtcars)), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) builder <- DSI::newDSLoginBuilder() builder$append(server = "study1", url = "dslite.server1", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") builder$append(server = "study2", url = "dslite.server2", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") logindata.dslite <- builder$build() # Login to the virtualized server conns <- DSI::datashield.login(logindata.dslite, assign = TRUE) #>  #> Logging into the collaborating servers #> Error in base::get(url, envir = getOption("datashield.env", parent.frame())): object 'dslite.server1' not found DSI::datashield.assign.table(conns = conns, symbol = "D", table = c("data", "data")) #> Error: object 'conns' not found  ## Examples # Example 1: parametric model model1 <- ds.gamlss(formula = mpg ~ wt, sigma.formula = ~disp, data = "D", family = "NO()") #> Error:  Are you logged in to any server? Please provide a valid DSConnection object!   # Example 2: penalized beta splines model2 <- ds.gamlss(formula = mpg ~ pb(wt), sigma.formula = ~disp, data = "D", family = "NO()") #> Error:  Are you logged in to any server? Please provide a valid DSConnection object!   # Example 3: penalized beta splines with known minimum and maximum model3 <- ds.gamlss(   formula = mpg ~ pb(wt), sigma.formula = ~disp,   min.values = min(mtcars$wt),   max.values = max(mtcars$wt),   min.max.names = "wt",   data = "D", family = "NO()" ) #> Error:  Are you logged in to any server? Please provide a valid DSConnection object!   ## Logout DSI::datashield.logout(conns) #> Error: object 'conns' not found

what: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
text: function predicts specified distribution parameter new data set ds.gamlss object output ds.gamlss function.

title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
text: object ds.gamlss object output ds.gamlss. newdata data frame containing new values explanatory variables used model. string, specifying distribution parameter predicted. Default ="mu". type string, specifying kind predictions derived. default value type="link" predicts linear predictor specified distribution parameter, whereas type="response" predicts fitted values distribution parameter.

title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
text: vector predictions newdata.

title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
text: ds.predict.gamlss function assumes object given newdata data frame containing explanatory variables used model.

title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
text: Annika Swenne

title: Derive predictions for ds.gamlss objects — ds.predict.gamlss
code: library(DSLite) data(mtcars)  ## Create newdata for predictions newdata <- data.frame(wt = seq(2, 5, by = 0.01))  ## Fit ds.gamlss model # Set up DSLite server dslite.server1 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(1:15), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) dslite.server2 <- newDSLiteServer(   tables = list(data = mtcars[c(16:nrow(mtcars)), ]),   config = defaultDSConfiguration(include = c("dsBase", "dsGamlss")) ) builder <- DSI::newDSLoginBuilder() builder$append(server = "study1", url = "dslite.server1", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") builder$append(server = "study2", url = "dslite.server2", table = "data", driver = "DSLiteDriver") logindata.dslite <- builder$build() # Login to the virtualized server conns <- DSI::datashield.login(logindata.dslite, assign = TRUE) #>  #> Logging into the collaborating servers #> Error in base::get(url, envir = getOption("datashield.env", parent.frame())): object 'dslite.server1' not found DSI::datashield.assign.table(conns = conns, symbol = "D", table = c("data", "data")) #> Error: object 'conns' not found # Fit model model <- ds.gamlss(formula = mpg ~ pb(wt), sigma.formula = ~wt, data = "D", family = "NO()") #> Error:  Are you logged in to any server? Please provide a valid DSConnection object!  # Logout DSI::datashield.logout(conns) #> Error: object 'conns' not found  ## Examples # Example 1: Predict mu mu.response <- ds.predict.gamlss(model, newdata, what = "mu", type = "response") #> Error: object 'model' not found  # Example 2: Predict linear predictor for sigma sigma.link <- ds.predict.gamlss(model, newdata, what = "sigma", type = "link") #> Error: object 'model' not found

what: dsGamlssClient: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape — dsGamlssClient-package
title: dsGamlssClient: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape — dsGamlssClient-package
text: DataSHIELD client-side functions fit Generalized Additive Models Location, Scale Shape using DataSHIELD. DataSHIELD software infrastructure allows non-disclosive federated analysis sensitive data. Note DataSHIELD client-server infrastructure, dsGamlss package needs used conjunction dsGamlssClient package.

title: dsGamlssClient: DataSHIELD client-side functions for Generalized Additive Models for Location, Scale and Shape — dsGamlssClient-package
text: Maintainer: Annika Swenne swenne@leibniz-bips.de

text: internal function required client function {ds.gamlss} verify variables specified formulas ds.gamlss model exist server ensure process halt inadvertently.

title: Check existence of variables in ds.gamlss model on each server — gamlssChecks
code: gamlssChecks(   formula,   sigma.formula,   nu.formula,   tau.formula,   data,   datasources )

title: Check existence of variables in ds.gamlss model on each server — gamlssChecks
text: formula string, specifying model mu distribution parameter. response left ~ operator, terms, separated + operators, right. Currently, penalized beta splines, indicated pb(), supported nonparametric smoothing, e.g. 'y~pb(x1)+x2+x2*x3'. sigma.formula string, specifying model sigma distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. sigma.formula='~pb(x)'. nu.formula string, specifying model nu distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. nu.formula='~pb(x)'. tau.formula string, specifying model tau distribution parameter, formula. difference , necessary specify response variable, e.g. tau.formula='~pb(x)'. data string, specifying name (optional) data frame server-side containing variables occurring formulas. missing, variables parent environment server-side referenced explicitly dataname$varname. datasources list DSConnection-class objects obtained login. datasources argument specified default set connections used: see datashield.connections_default.

title: Check existence of variables in ds.gamlss model on each server — gamlssChecks
text: integer, 0 check passed 1 tests failed

title: Check existence of variables in ds.gamlss model on each server — gamlssChecks
text: variables formulas checked ensure exist empty, .e., missing completely.

title: Check existence of variables in ds.gamlss model on each server — gamlssChecks
text: Annika Swenne

code: isDefined(datasources = NULL, obj = NULL, error.message = TRUE)

title: Check if an object is defined on all servers — isDefined
text: datasources list DSConnection-class objects obtained login. datasources argument specified default set connections used: see datashield.connections_default. obj string name object(s) look . error.message Boolean specifies function stop return error message input object defined one servers (error.message=TRUE) return list TRUE/FALSE indicating server object defined (error.message=FALSE). Default error.message=TRUE.

title: Check if an object is defined on all servers — isDefined
text: error message error.message argument set TRUE (default) input object defined one servers, Boolean value error.message=FALSE.

title: Check if an object is defined on all servers — isDefined
text: DataSHIELD object included analysis must defined (.e. exists) servers. process halt.
